content.title: Factory status May 2024 (TPM/Eng)
content.visibleText:
Factory status May 2024 (TPM/Eng)

Factory status April 2024 (TPM/Eng)

Summary
Kanban Slots
Jigsaw (1 slot)
IgniteTech #1: Security
IgniteTech #2: Copilot
IgniteTech Maintenance
GFI (1 slot)
Influitive (2 slots)
Stratifyd (1 slot)
Crossover (1 slot)
Applied AI (1 slot)
Telco (3 slots + 1 Ops slot)
TPM only slots (1 slot)

Maintenance Delivery scorecard
Burndown charts - road to zero...
All BUs
IgniteTech
CopperTree
Jigsaw
Influitive
 had a great month. We have already delivered 88% of our Q2 orders (goal: 20 tickets per SE7), and we are on track to overdeliver for all BUs.
We removed 62% of our backlog in Q2 so far and are on track to eliminate our backlog in Q2.
You can find the delivery scorecard and the burndown charts at the bottom of the document.

Early Customer Adoption
PMs hired in April were assigned to 3 BUs (Ignite, Jigsaw, Influitive). We made progress, but results are below what we would have wanted and usage/activity remains low:
Messenger: of 20 customers, 4 customers showed interest, none has concrete upgrade plans (many want to wait until the new version is proven stable)
Jive Security: of 12 customers, 3 are interested in upgrading.
Jive Cloud AI Copilot: 2 customers actively using it, 7 have it enabled, most have it disabled

What went well:
Focus on customer problems - conducted calls to understand their problems (for projects in early stages), help them use the product (for AI features), or get them to upgrade (for defense projects)
Focus on business value: analyzing usage (e.g., Jive Copilot Usage Report) and acting upon it

What did not go well:
We started without a clear framework and spent time aligning expectations, navigating our org, or doing work that we did actually believe to be in our advantage.

 we are fixing this by defining the service
TPM Slot - Early Adoption Service
Add key takeaways

Other topics
Cost reduction: tbd
Providing updates during renewal: TPM will provide content to Renewals that talks about product investments which will be made available to customers during the renewal process

Kanban Slots

Jigsaw (1 slot)
1 commit defense goal - delivered, release made available to customers with 4 customers requesting access to date
1 stretch defense goal - canceled in agreement with the BU after reassessing its value
4 new defense goals were added mid-quarter: 2 already delivered, 1 pending completion by EoQ2 and the 4th blocked on the customer side

Jigsaw (1 slot)
Commit: Upgrade Messenger to Java 11, fix two vulnerabilities, support three OSes
NEW goal: Monitor: Overcome Lufthansa PCI audit issues, support new OSS, L4 vulnerabilities
NEW goal: Monitor: Upgrade Interceptor SDK to Java 11
DONE

NEW goal: Monitor: Upgrade Webmethods Interceptor to version 8.10.5 (Java 11)

NEW goal: Messenger Java 17 upgrade
OFF TRACK

After we completed the migration of Messenger to Java 11 in April, and then shifted our focus to Aurea Monitor's top customers:
Lufthansa failed the PCI audit due to security issues with Monitor - this is now fixed
SoftwareAG was blocked from upgrading its white-label product because the interceptor did not support Java 11. We have released a version that will enable that upgrade.

Now, we have covered $11M out of $12M planned ARR customers, but we are seeing low adoption:
Half (10) of high ARR customers who requested the changes answered our request for deployment plans
Our customers are very slow to upgrade. Only 4/20 ($1.6M) asked for the new version but don't plan upgrading in Q2. We will reach out to the entire customer base but, most likely, no customers will upgrade within Q2.

Risk: SoftwareAG must provide installation and use case instructions to enable us to prepare the environment and tools and test the upgrade. This step is impossible to avoid as we build software that connects with third-party tools. Action: We are pushing them to provide the necessary licenses and information to unblock this activity.

We expect to deliver it the first week of June.

We continue simplifying the deliverables while maintaining the business objective. This enabled us to overdeliver and extend the number of business objectives this quarter for the second month in a row.

We must provide all improvements done in the products to the Renewals team so they can start the discussion based on these deliverables.

content.title: Factory status May 2024 (TPM/Eng)
content.layoutDescription: Document layout with text and bullet points
content.visibleText: Factory status April 2024 (TPM/Eng) - Summary - Kanban Slots - Jigsaw (1 slot) - IgniteTech #1: Security - IgniteTech #2: Copilot - IgniteTech Maintenance - GFI (1 slot) - Influitive (2 slots) - Stratifyd (1 slot) - Crossover (1 slot) - Applied AI (1 slot) - Telco (3 slots + 1 Ops slot) - TPM only slots (1 slot) - Maintenance Delivery scorecard - Burndown charts - road to zero... - All BUs - IgniteTech - CopperTree - Jigsaw - Influitive - Early Customer Adoption - PMs hired in April were assigned to 3 BUs (Ignite, Jigsaw, Influitive). We made progress, but results showed waste and usage (activity remains low): - Messenger: of 20 customers, 4 customers showed interest, none has concrete upgrade plans - Jive Security: of 12 customers, 3 are interested in upgrading. - Jive Cloud AI Copilot: 2 customers actively using it, 7 have it enabled, most have it disabled - Influitive AI Feature: outreach started recently - What went well - Focus on customer problems - conduct calls to understand their problems (for projects such as Jive Cloud AI Copilot) - What did not go well: - Focused without a clear framework and spent time aligning expectations, navigating low rates. We should have contacted all customers to increase the size of the early adoption pool. Long upgrade cycles for hosted projects (Messenger, Jive HQP) make it impossible to demonstrate customer value during the quarter. - Low response rate on our attempts to get them to use the new features - Improvements: we are fixing this by defining the service - TPM Slot - Early Adoption Service - Add key workflows (TPM focus on early adoption, everything else is BU responsibility) - Other topics - Cost reduction: tbd - Product updates during renewal: TPM will provide content to Renewals that talks about product investments which will be made available to customers during the renewal process
